name: Tortue
tagline: Development of a mobile robot with a roomba base and 3D motion controller
body:
### Tortue

![logo](https://a248.e.akamai.net/camo.github.com/101daa11a5e23808cc604fefa9af60a3163bfd22/687474703a2f2f342e62702e626c6f6773706f742e636f6d2f2d655833347a434b34336d552f5555376e6f56635a4c46492f41414141414141414361452f734147585538544c6436592f73313630302f746f727475652d322e6a7067)

Tortue is an ongoing project aimed to develop a mobile robot with a Roomba 5XX base and a 3D motion controller, using the [Robot Operating System (ROS) Platform](http://www.ros.org/wiki/). Latest release is version 1.0.0 which uses a Roomba 560 base and [ASUS Xtion Pro Live](http://www.asus.com/Multimedia/Xtion_PRO_LIVE/) motion sensor on [ROS Electric Emys](http://www.ros.org/wiki/electric).

![Version-1.0.0](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-DNwXLK-WAz4/UYF-xgmS0lI/AAAAAAAACpY/DxF5bodY8E8/w333-h269/ugprez.jpg)

### Video Links
1. [Basic obstacle avoidance, Tortue Version-1.0.0](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZPhbyOlCq08)

### Release
Version-1.0.0
~~~~~~~~~~~
Date : 30 March 2013, Saturday
Hardware : Roomba 560, ASUS Xtion Pro Live, iRobot FTDI cable, 
           ACER Aspire One notebook laptop
Software Platform : ROS Electric (ROS 1.6.9)
Accomplishments : Basic obstacle avoidance using pcl
~~~~~~~~~~~

### Dependencies
For this ROS package, the following must be installed, 

1. [roomba_robot](https://github.com/Arkapravo/roomba_500_ROS_drivers)
2. [serial_communication](https://github.com/Arkapravo/roomba_500_ROS_drivers)
3. [openni_kinect](http://ros.org/wiki/openni_kinect?distro=electric)
4. [perception_pcl](http://www.ros.org/wiki/perception_pcl?distro=electric)

It may be advisable to have a read about the [roomba 500 drivers package](http://arkapravo.github.io/roomba_500_ROS_drivers/) installation and running.  

### To build the package
Make sure the package is in your [ROS_PACKAGE_PATH](http://www.ros.org/wiki/ROS/EnvironmentVariables#ROS_PACKAGE_PATH)
```
$ rosmake tortue
```
### To run the package
This package should work well for any robot equipped with a Roomba 5XX base and an OpenNI device. We have used Roomba 560 and ASUS Xtion Pro Live.

![roomba 560](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-n5mU-b1D3rc/UNzHyTT7uLI/AAAAAAAACMg/za72x4dNqmk/s450/roomba-e.jpg)

![Xtion Pro-Live](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-Eh56mOiwZ-w/UYuhIetGZ3I/AAAAAAAACqQ/RUMf8-EmQpg/w467-h231-no/1311014735-asus-xtion-pro-live-launching-soon-2.png)

Make sure the Roomba is connected via an ftdi or bluetooth and switch on the robot, the CLEAN button will have a light on, start the following node,

```
$ roslaunch tortue.launch
```
